required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: One Touch VerioIQ US Clinical Outcomes Study
clinical_study.official_title: One Touch VerioIQ US Clinical Outcomes Study

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the clinical benefits of One Touch VerioIQ system

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluation of the clinical benefits of the One Touch VerioIQ system. The system contains pattern alert technology and comes with educational material (Pattern guide) which provides additional support and insights to patients and health care providers to help them make more informed decisions during blood glucose management.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in A1C From Baseline to Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Change in A1C from baseline to week 24

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in A1C From Baseline to Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Change in A1C from baseline to week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in FPG From Baseline to 24 Weeks and Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) from baseline to 24 weeks and over time

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Proportion of Subjects With A1C Less Than or Equal to 7.0% at Week 24
Change in 30 Day Mean Glucose Comparing First Month to Last Month After 24 Weeks

arm_group.description: Subjects replaced own Blood Glucose Monitoring system with VerioIQ.

intervention.intervention_name: One Touch VerioIQ Blood Glucose Monitor
intervention.description: BGM with pattern alert technology and with associated pattern guide

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male or female at least 18 to 80 years old
- ADA guidelines for FPG and PPG appropriate
- A1C greater or equal to 8.0% and less than or equal to 10.5%
- lab A1C greater than or equal to 8.0% in the last 6-12mths
- Diagnosed with type 1 or 2 in at least last 1 year
- on stable dose of OADs for at least 3mths prior to screening
- willingness to test 7 BGM tests per day
- willing to remain on same therapy as baseline (MDI) for duration of study
Exclusion Criteria:
- unlikely to be compliant to study procedures
- has or has currently used One Touch VerioIQ
- Is on fixed doses of insulin for MDI therapy

overall_official.affiliation: Baylor Endocrine Center, 3600 Gaston Avenue Wadley Tower, Suite 656, Dallas, TX 75246, Phone: 214-820-3466, Fax: 214-820-3468

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: No data was analysed as study was terminated early before any data was collected.
